reviews.review_msg:
Dr. Williams did a great job teaching this course. The material was always interesting and relevant. We also got to decide what topics we would like to learn about. 

If you are taking 391 with him, I strongly recommend taking plenty of notes, and going to office hours if you think you missed something.

Vance is such a funny and caring professor; exams were open book and very fair. Assignments were a bit trickier. Overall, it was a fun class, and it is clear that professor Vance is very knowledgeable

Overall really enjoyed the class.  He has extensive knowledge of not just the chemistry but all of interesting history of where the chemistry came from which is neat.  Posts lecture slides ahead of class which I find hugely helpful.  Teaching was clear with lots of examples, no textbook used in either classes I took with him.

He was a decent instructor, clearly having an interest in chemistry. I did well in his class and only attended 66% of the lectures. Overall I liked him as a person and found him to be crystal clear. The only downfall was that there was no textbook.
